title: Can't Uninstall Game Or Reinstall
body:
I have windows 10.

My client repeatedly crashed upon pressing "Launch" so I attempted to use the repair option. This did nothing to fix the problem so I attempted to uninstall and reinstall league. 

Going into the uninstall programs section of control panel, there were 2 league of legends options. I managed to uninstall one, but attempting to uninstall the other gave the message "The feature you are trying to use is on a network resource that is unavailable. Click OK to try again, or enter alternate path to a folder containing the installation package 'LoL.EUNE.msi' in the box below".


 I have deleted all LoL files from C: and roaming and wasn't able to find any more folders.

When attempting to install a new version of LoL I get the message "The older version of League of Legends cannot be removed. Contact your technical support group."

Like most people, I do not have a technical support group, this is an incredibly poor error message.

replies.body: The patcher not opening is usually due to a permission issue with Windows preventing access to game files.  We have a [Permissions ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)guide that can help out with this.   I'm not sure if it will fully address the other errors you are receiving unrelated to the patcher, and for your specific issue I recommend reaching out to our teach team by [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Hope that helps!
